Alpino.sent_id = wpspel: questions  used in a QA project (source)[https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Dutch-Alpino/tree/master]

EWT.sent_id = answers: Question-answers are posts from Yahoo!s community-driven question-answering web site, Yahoo! Answers, where individuals submit and answer questions which may be on any topic. This data was collected in 2011 (source)[https://catalog.ldc.upenn.edu/LDC2012T13]

Taiga.genre = QA: Questions and answers from otvet.mail.ru. Information about the source is in the data: each review  has sent_id starting with otvet.mail.ru-question. Additional information is given in the following metadata: author, title.

GUM.sent_id = GUM_academic: 18 academic articles from different knowledge areas (source)[https://gucorpling.org/gum/]

LinES.sent_id = .*doc[234678]: Six of the sub-corpora are taken from literary works: Paul Auster: City of Glass. The New York Trilogy, Volume One. First published by Faber & Faber in 1985. Saul Bellow: To Jerusalem and back: a personal accunt. First published in 1976. Joseph Conrad: Heart of darkness. First published in 1899 as a serial in Blackwood's Magazine, in 1902 as a book. Nadine Gordimer: A Guest of Honour. First published in 1970. J. K. Rowling: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets. First published in 1998. Jennette Winterson: Gut Symmetries. Granta Books, London, 1998. Information about prefix pattern is provided by the main developer (source)[https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_English-LinES]

HSE.nopattern: Chukotko-Kamchatkan & anecdotes, songs, parables, autobiographical stories, fairy tales, everyday dialogues, retellings of silent movie fragments (source)[https://chuklang.ru/full_texts]

Atis.nopattern: human speech transcriptions of people asking for flight information on the automated inquiry systems (source)[https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_English-Atis]

GUM.sent_id = GUM_conversation: UCSB Corpus (source)[https://gucorpling.org/gum/],  Santa Barbara Corpus of Spoken American English is based on a large body of recordings of naturally occurring spoken interaction from all over the United States. The Santa Barbara Corpus represents a wide variety of people of different regional origins, ages, occupations, genders, and ethnic and social backgrounds. The predominant form of language use represented is face-to-face conversation, but the corpus also documents many other ways that that people use language in their everyday lives: telephone conversations, card games, food preparation, on-the-job talk, classroom lectures, sermons, story-telling, town hall meetings, tour-guide spiels, and more (source)[https://www.linguistics.ucsb.edu/research/santa-barbara-corpus]

ParisStories.nopattern: monologues and dialogues from speakers living in the Parisian region, students had to record a friend or a relative sharing an anecdote about a given theme (meaningful encounters, vacations, interesting stories..) (source)[https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_French-ParisStories]

Rhapsodie.nopattern: 57 spoken French examples, private and public speech, monologues and dialogues (source)[https://rhapsodie.modyco.fr/francais-parle/]

GPS.sent_id = P: narrations of Wallace Chafe's Pear Stories video (pearstories.org) by heritage speakers of Gheg Albanian. To extract the instances, metadata starting with sent\_id = P is used (speakers from Prishtina), we exclude the instances of speakers from Switzerland since they contain a lot of code-switching (mostly Swiss-German) (source)[https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Gheg-GPS]

IKDP.nopattern: Iźva dialect transcriptions of spoken Komi Zyrian (source)[https://archive.mpi.nl/tla/islandora/object/tla%3A1839_00_0000_0000_0021_64F1_D

NSC.nopattern: spoken Naija (Nigerian Pidgin), monologues and dialogues, metadata contains the topic as in 'ABJ_GWA_14_Mary-Lifestory_MG' (source)[https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Naija-NSC]

NynorskLIA.nopattern: dialect recordings made in the period between 1950--1990 (source)[https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Norwegian-NynorskLIA]

ARCOSG.sent_id = c: Conversation. c01 is in test, c03 in dev and the rest in train. These are transcripts of interviews in the Western Isles from 1998 to 2000. In c03 and c04 speakers 2, 4 and 5 are children.
ARCOSG.sent_id = n\\d: Oral narrative. n01: Na Trì Leinntean Canaich (test), n02: Conall Gulban (dev), n03: Na Fiantaichean, n04: Gille an Fheadain Duibh, n05: Bodach Ròcabarraigh, n06: Iain Beag MacAnndra, n07: Fear a' Churracain Ghlais, n08: Boban Saor, n09: Bean 'ic Odrum, n10: Blàr Chàirinis (source)[https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Scottish_Gaelic-ARCOSG]

SST.nopattern: a collection of transcribed audio recordings of monologic, dialogic and multi-party spontaneous speech in different everyday situations. The treebank is representative of speakers (sex, age, region, education), communication channels (TV, radio, telephone, personal contact) and communication settings (TV and radio shows, lectures, meetings, consultations, services, conversations between friends etc.) (source)[https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Slovenian-SST]

Atis.nopattern: human speech transcriptions of people asking for flight information on the automated inquiry systems, a translation of English ATIS (Airline Travel Information System) corpus (source)[https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Turkish-Atis]

SAGT.nopattern: 48 distinct conversations from 17 participants. The majority of the speakers are university students, hence the most frequent age range is 18–25. Common conversation themes include studies, work, travel, free time activities such as sports, books, TV, and future plans. (source)[https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Turkish_German-SAGT]

GUM.sent_id = GUM_textbook: 15 OpenStax texbooks related to different knowledge areas (source)[https://gucorpling.org/gum/]

BSUT.sent_id = wiki: source inferred from prefix, the label 'wiki' is in UD labels for this treebank

GSD.nopattern: Wikipedia data, manually verified. The label 'wiki' is in UD labels

LassySmall.nopattern: Wikipedia section of the Lassy Small Treebank (source)[https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Dutch-LassySmall]

IAHLTwiki.nopattern: 5,000 contemporary Hebrew sentences representing a variety of texts originating from Wikipedia entries. It includes various text domains, such as: biography, law, finance, health, places, events and miscellaneous. (source)[https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Hebrew-IAHLTwiki]

PUD.sent_id = w: Wikipedia (sentence id starts with ‘w’), standard prefix in all PUD treebanks
Wikipedia (sentence id starts with ‘w’), standard prefix in all PUD treebanks

SynTagRus.genre = wiki: Russian Wikipedia, source inferred from prefix

SNK.sent_id = wikipedia: source inferred from prefix, originally only present in dev data

SSJ.sent_id = .*sl: Slovenian subset of the ELEXIS parallel sense-annotated corpus of Wikipedia texts (source)[https://aclanthology.org/2022.law-1.3.pdf]

ArmTDP.sent_id = wiki: source inferred from prefix, label in UD labels
